Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 11, 2022. Due to the violations of the licensing rules a corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing rules.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date an
initial treatment plan for each resident within 30 calendar days
of admission.
Three youth files that required an initial treatment plan during the period under
review were reviewed. Two of the three files had initial treatment plans that were
completed after the required timeframe.
R 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio.
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
A random review of bed check logs was reviewed. All bed checks were completed
on the 15-minute mark instead of at the required variable intervals.
R 400.4153 Shelter care and detention institutions; preliminary service
plans.
Within 7 calendar days of admission, a plan shall be developed
for each resident. The plan shall include all of the following:
(a) The reason for care.
(b) An assessment of the resident’s immediate and specific
needs.
(c) The specific services to be provided by the institution.
(d) Other resources to meet the resident’s needs.
One of one youth placed in detention file was reviewed and had service plans that
were not completed in the required timeframes.
R 400.4407 Facility and premises maintenance.
(6) Plumbing fixtures and water and waste pipes shall be
properly installed and maintained in good working condition.
4

A tree had fallen on the fence in the outdoor recreation yard causing damage. A
temporary fence was constructed around the damaged fence and was weighted and
secured to the existing fence. I was informed that the facility is in the process of
obtaining bits and securing a contractor to repair the fence.
The following lavatory drains were slow draining: B6, B5, B1, A1 A4, A6, S4, D1, D3,
D4, D5 and D6.
The following toilet were not draining properly or had excessive flush times: S3, and
D4.
Repair the drains and toilets so they are operating properly.
R 400.4411 Natural light.
(2) Every habitable room shall have artificial light capable of
providing not less than 20 footcandles of illumination at a height
of 3 feet above the floor.
Rooms S4 and S5 did not have artificial lights. Provide artificial lighting in these
rooms.
R 400.4414 Water supply.
(2) Each sink, lavatory, bath, shower, drinking fountain, and
other water outlet shall be supplied with safe and potable water
which is sufficient in quantity and pressure to meet the
conditions of peak demand. Hot and cold or tempered water
shall be provided in each sink, lavatory, bath, and shower. Hot
water temperatures shall not exceed 120 degrees Fahrenheit at
outlets accessible to residents.
5

Hot water exceeded 120 degrees Fahrenheit (F) in all of the resident rooms and
common recreation room faucets. The locker room showers and faucets also
exceeded 120 F. Temperatures ranged from 121 – 125 degrees F. Pod shower
room and lavatory faucets were 120 degrees F or below, no falling below 100 F.
Hot water will be required to be adjusted so water outlets accessible to residents
does not exceed 120 degrees F.
The follow lavatories had weak or intermittent water pressure:
A3, S8, and D1. Repair water to allow for enough pressure to allow for adequate
handwashing and water usage.
R 400.4414 Water supply.
(3) Plumbing shall be installed and maintained to prevent cross
connections with the water supply.
An AMES 4000SS RPZ backflow preventer was installed on the water line serving
the building fire suppression system. No inspection tag was observed on the RPZ
that stated it was inspected and passed inspection within the last 3 years.
Staff provided a picture of a pressure vacuum breaker for the water line serving the
outdoor sprinkler system. No information was provided as to whether the pressure
vacuum breaker passed a vacuum breaker test within the last 3 years and no device
tag was observed.
The RPZ and the pressure vacuum breaker must be inspected and tested by an
individual who is a certified backflow preventer tester valid in the State of Michigan.
If the devices have been inspected and tested and passed within the last 3 years,
please provide PHDM with the inspection report for review.
R 400.4420 Food service facilities, equipment, and procedures.
Facilities, equipment, and procedures used in the preparation,
storage, and service of food shall comply with the applicable
provisions of sections 12901 to 12922 of Act No. 368 of the
Public Acts of 1978, as amended, being SS333.12901 to
333.12922 of the Michigan Compiled Laws. The facilities,
equipment, and procedures required shall depend on the
amount of food service and the type of food service operation.
6

The kitchen inspection revealed the following:
The hot water sanitizing dish machine was providing water at sufficient temperature
to sanitize the surfaces of dishes to 160F.
A leaked substances was present in a box of apples. A rotten apple was observed to
be present. PIC was going to speak with staff to determine if any other substance
could have been introduced into the apples or if it was from the rotten apple. PIC
was then either going to discard the apples if it was a different substance or remove
the rotten apple and then was the remaining apples that remained good condition.
Opened packages of cream cheese, almond milk, and brewed tea were not provided
with date marks. PIC provided date marks for the tea and almond milk since they
were opened/brewed within the last 7 days. PIC was going to speak with the staff
about the date the cream cheese was opened and will either provide a date mark or
discard the cream cheese if it was opened more than 7 days ago.
All coolers were maintaining food at or below 41 degrees F.
R 400.4431 Heating equipment.
(2) Hot water radiators or steam radiators and pipes or any
other heating device capable of causing a burn shall be
effectively shielded.
The radiator cover had been removed from the radiator in room D1. Reinstall
radiator cover.
R 400.4506 Fire drills and telephone.
(1) There shall be quarterly emergency fire drills for each staff
shift. Two of the drills shall include evacuations, unless
approved by the department, in writing, as clinically
contraindicated. Where a facility has a 24-hour staff shift, the
emergency drills shall be conducted at different times of the day
and night. Written records shall be maintained for each drill
indicating the date and time of the drill and, where evacuation
was a part of the drill, the approximate evacuation time.
Conduct fire drills at different times of the day and night. Fire drills are currently
being conducted at the same times of the day.
R 400.4524 Fire detection; large facilities.
(8) Fire alarm systems shall be tested and maintained on an
annual basis in accordance with NFPA 72. Smoke detector
7

calibration shall be done as recommended. The licensee shall
keep a record of fire alarm maintenance.
Provide a current annual fire alarm inspection report. Batteries in the FACP were
installed in 2014.
R 400.4527 Sprinkler systems.
(2) All required sprinkler systems shall be inspected and tested
and all other maintenance performed as specified in the 2014
national fire protection association standard No. 25 entitled
"Standard for the Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance of
Water-Based Fire Protection Systems" at least once a year by a
sprinkler contractor. The licensee shall maintain documentation
of the last inspection and test.
Provide a current sprinkler systems inspections report. The sprinkler gauges need to
be replaced. Expired 2021.
R 400.4538 Means of egress.
(1) Means of egress shall be considered the entire way and
method of passage to free and safe ground outside a facility. All
required means of egress shall be maintained in unobstructed,
easily traveled condition at all times.
A pop machine is obstructing egress by the visitor rooms. The pop machine needs to
be relocated.
R 400.4552 Heating devices and flame-producing devices.
(8) All furnaces shall be inspected on an annual basis by a
licensed inspector. A copy of the inspection must be made
available to the qualified fire inspector or the department's
licensing authority upon request.
Provide a current boiler inspection and State boiler certification.
R 400.4560 Cooking appliances.
(2) Where metal hoods or canopies are provided over domestic
cooking appliances, they shall be equipped with filters which
shall be maintained in an efficient and clean condition.
Provide a current kitchen hood cleaning report. Hood cleanings are needed every 6
months.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility had sixteen special investigations during this period under review with six
resulting in corrective action plans. The facility’s corrective action plan compliance is
monitored quarterly, and they have completed several action steps and are in ongoing
compliance with all additional corrective action plans steps.
Chief Administrator
Chief Administrator acknowledged the citations from the prior year and the corrective
action plans that have been implemented to make changes and rectify the issues they
have had throughout the period under review. Chief Administrator reported the facility
has continually been working on communication at all levels in order to all work
together for the benefit of the youth.
Interviews
Interviews with youth and staff were conducted. Youth reported feeling safe, receiving
treatment, and having all needs met. Staff reported they feel supported by the current
administration and feel the facility is moving in a positive direction. Staff report they
feel it is a safe environment to work in and for the youth to live in.
9

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
